official-title.#text:
To prohibit anticompetitive activities and to provide
		  that health insurance issuers and medical malpractice insurance issuers are
		  subject to the antitrust laws of the United States, and for other
		  purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Health Insurance Industry Antitrust
			 Enforcement Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

Notwithstanding any other provision of law,
			 nothing in the

, shall be construed to permit health
			 insurance issuers (as defined in

) or issuers of medical malpractice insurance to engage in
			 any form of price fixing, bid rigging, or market allocations in connection with
			 the conduct of the business of providing health insurance coverage (as defined
			 in such section) or coverage for medical malpractice claims or actions.

quote.#tail: has the meaning given it in

text.#text:
Nothing contained in this Act shall modify,
				impair, or supersede the operation of any of the antitrust laws with respect to
				the business of health insurance. For purposes of the preceding sentence, the
				term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall apply
			 with respect to the business of health insurance without regard to whether such
			 business is carried on for profit, notwithstanding the definition of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 4 of the Federal Trade
			 Commission Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to the extent such section applies to unfair
			 methods of competition,
